result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas N Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Case to be expunged upon payment of fine.

Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA sheet - sample provided by defendant
Defendant, Nicholas N Nelson, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney recited. Court imposed $673.50 fine (paid). Submit DNA. Court ruled case be expunged.

Defendant, Nicholas N Nelson, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead guilty to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence to be set six months out. Case to be expunged upon payment of $673.50 fine. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. No jail credit.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant, Nicholas N Nelson, appeared pro se. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney recited. Defendant wished to go forward today without attorney.
not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess any drug paraphernalia

Defendant, Nicholas N Nelson, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $200 recog. bond. Not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:40 pm.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
